impact_weight: The reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can be achieved through the use of renewable energy sources, which in turn can aid in the achievement of renewable energy targets.
Improving energy efficiency can help reduce greenhouse gas emissions, thereby reinforcing energy efficiency targets.
The production of biofuels may compete with the production of renewable hydrogen, potentially constraining the growth of the renewable hydrogen sector.
The development of hydrogen distribution infrastructure can create conditions that further the growth of the renewable energy sector, particularly in the context of hydrogen production.
The focus on hydrogen distribution may limit options for improving energy efficiency in other areas, such as building insulation or smart grids.
Promoting urban mobility through sustainable means, such as electric vehicles, can create conditions that further the adoption of solar energy, particularly in urban areas.
Improving transport logistics can aid in the efficient transportation of offshore wind equipment and materials, reinforcing the growth of the offshore wind sector.
The development of net-zero technology for road vehicles can create conditions that further the growth of the solar energy sector, particularly in the context of electric vehicle charging.
The focus on other low-carbon fuels may counteract efforts to improve energy efficiency, as these fuels may not be as efficient as other alternatives.
The development of rail infrastructure can aid in the transportation of renewable energy equipment and materials, reinforcing the growth of the renewable energy sector.
Improving rail infrastructure can create conditions that further the improvement of energy efficiency, particularly in the context of freight transportation.
